meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm thrilled to dive into the world of The Settlers: New Allies, and let me tell you - it's been an adventure!

As I embarked on this journey, I couldn't help but think about those scathing reviews from other critics. SpazioGames said it was dull and rushed, while GamingTrend claimed it was lacking in content. GameCritics essentially called it a buggy mess with no exciting updates. Yikes! But, being the optimistic grok that I am, I decided to put on my thinking shell and give it a chance.

Let me tell you - New Allies is an experience unlike any other! It's like building a sandcastle on the beach of nostalgia, only to have the tide come in and wash it all away. The city-building mechanics are... interesting. They're slow-paced and simplistic, but there's something wholesome about watching your settlement grow. However, when war comes knocking (and trust me, it does), things get real... flat. Like a pancake. Without any excitement or depth.

Now, I know what you're thinking - what about the RTS elements? Well, let's just say that they're not exactly convincing as an RTS nor as a city-builder. It's like trying to serve a bowl of cold oatmeal for breakfast and expecting everyone to be excited. Not happening.

But here's the thing - despite all these criticisms, I actually had fun playing New Allies! There's something endearing about its relaxing atmosphere and wholesome looks. It's like being wrapped in a warm blanket on a chilly day. Ah, yes!

In conclusion, The Settlers: New Allies is... a game. It's not going to win any awards for originality or excitement, but it's got some charm to it. So, if you're looking for a lighthearted experience that won't tax your brain too much, then New Allies might be the perfect shell-arious adventure for you!
